issue.title: [CF 805] Conditions compilation fails when spell names contain quotes
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Creating a condition for spell that has quotes in the name (I've only seen those in localized version for RU, but may happen anywhere)

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?

Generated function code for condition declares a local variable in the very beginning with the value "<spell_name>".
When spell name contains quotes (in Russian localization literally 'Command "Kill!"') it turns into local <some_variable> = "Command "Kill!"" and obviously compilation of that function fails. It then starts failing anywhere where it's trying to apply the condition, presumably because function compilation returned nil and it's being used from there.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.1.5

Do you have an error log of what happened?
To be added.

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
Substituting name with ID obviously mitigates the problem.


> Posted by CurseForge user Grozo | Imported from CurseForge issue #805 | Raw

comments.body:
Thanks. I neglected to use proper string wrapping for the c.GCDReplacedNameFirst substitution (it was done properly for all other subs, but not that one).

Fixed in r799.

Changelog:

  • Conditions that use the c.GCDReplacedNameFirst condition substitution will no longer fail to compile when the spell being subbed in contains a double quote.

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thanks. Add-on itself and the support is amazing and well worth the donation :)


> Posted by CurseForge user Grozo

Thank you very much for that! You are awesome :)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
